item.title: Too Big
item.content:encoded:
https://aftermath.site/acer-nitro-blaze-11-screen-too-big-steam-deck

The Consumer Electronics Show is taking place this week in Las Vegas, and you know what that means: impractical tech announcements out the wazoo (and, like, three things that are actually cool). Among the former is Acer‚Äôs new Nitro Blaze 11 gaming handheld, which has a 10.95-inch screen. I love a gleaming, glorious window into the digital realm as much as the next guy, but I‚Äôm sorry: That‚Äôs too big. 

I submit just one piece of evidence: the above picture. That should be enough, because look at it! My man is studying Balatro hands on a device five times the size of his own. He‚Äôs attempting a Hades II run while explaining to a child that the whole world is ‚Äúthiiiiiiiiiiiis big.‚Äù He‚Äôs playing the Tony Hawk remasters on a surface he could attach wheels to and use as a skateboard.

This is a handheld only in the technical sense; it does indeed require hands to hold, but probably many more than you or I actually possess. Like any member of our exceedingly exhausted species, I enjoy playing my Steam Deck while lying down in bed. Due to the width of that device, however, my wrists, elbows, and shoulders tend to tap out after an hour or so. Imagine trying to use the Nitro Blaze 11 in that scenario. You‚Äôd succumb to cramps you didn‚Äôt even know your body could produce in seconds.

At the very least, the Nitro Blaze 11 includes a built-in kickstand and detachable controllers, but that merely gestures at the problem. It does not solve it. If you're mainly planning to perch this thing atop another surface and play it from a couch or a chair, you do not want a handheld; you're looking for a console or gaming PC, both of which you likely already have if you're the kind of person who'd considering buying a device like this for the low, low price of $1,099.99.

I‚Äôm guessing that Acer ‚Äì which also announced the 8.8-inch Nitro Blaze 8 ‚Äì is testing the limits here or engaging in a full-on marketing stunt, the kind which companies lean on during CES to stand out among a crowded convention hall. Either way, take it from me, somebody who plays almost everything on handhelds despite owning a pretty decent gaming PC: too big.

item.title: The Sonic Movies Have Now Made Over A Billion Dollars
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/sonic-3-live-action-sega-movie-1-billion-box-office-1851733653

Sonic the Hedgehog 3 hit theaters late last month and has already grossed more than $300 million worldwide, pushing the film series based on Sega‚Äôs popular video games past the one-billion mark and making it one of Paramount‚Äôs biggest ongoing franchises.

Suggested Reading

The Top 10 Most-Played Games On Steam Deck: August 2023 Edition

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

On January 5, Paramount Pictures put out a press release confirming that the live-action Sonic the Hedgehog film franchise has now made over $1 billion at the box office. That means it‚Äôs made more than Halloween, Paranormal Activity, and A Quiet Place.

For Paramount, Sonic has become a very important franchise at a time when the studio has struggled to squeeze massive blockbusters out of past winners, like Transformers and Star Trek. So it‚Äôs not shocking that as Sonic crosses the 1-billion-dollar mark, Paramount is already working on a sequel. The next movie is reportedly arriving in 2027.

‚ÄúThe Sonic the Hedgehog franchise has become an unstoppable cultural force with limitless potential,‚Äù said Paramount Pictures President & CEO Brian Robbins. ‚ÄúCongratulations to our partners at SEGA, our filmmaking team...who have revolutionized the heights that Sonic can reach, and the legions of loyal and devoted fans who have helped guide us every step of the way.‚Äù

It feels like a lifetime ago when the first Sonic the Hedgehog film teaser hit the web and we all got to see that original, ugly CG Sonic that was so monstrous, fans backlashed hard enough to force Paramount and Sega to change the character‚Äôs look into something less awful. That first film ended up making $319 million at the box office.

In 2022, Sonic 2 hit theaters, receiving better reviews and making over $400 million. There was a Knuckles spin-off TV show in early 2024, but nobody talks about that. Then finally, in December, Paramount released Sonic the Hedgehog 3, which is one of the highest-rated video game movies in history and has already made more money than the first film in just about two weeks. Pretty good for a hedgehog that runs really fast.

item.title: AMD‚Äôs new Ryzen Z2 CPUs boost gaming handhelds, if you buy the best one
item.content:encoded:
https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2025/01/amds-new-ryzen-z2-cpus-boost-gaming-handhelds-if-you-buy-the-best-one/

Nearly two years ago, AMD announced its first Ryzen Z1 processors. These were essentially the same silicon that AMD was putting in high-end thin-and-light laptops but tuned specifically for handheld gaming PCs like the Steam Deck and Asus ROG Ally X. As part of its CES announcements today, AMD is refreshing that lineup with three processors, all slated for an undisclosed date in the first quarter of 2025.

Although they're all part of the "Ryzen Z2" family, each of these three chips is actually much different under the hood, and some of them are newer than others.

The Ryzen Z2 Extreme is what you'd expect from a refresh: a straightforward upgrade to both the CPU and GPU architectures of the Ryzen Z1 Extreme. Based on the same "Strix Point" architecture as the Ryzen AI 300 laptop processors, the Z2 Extreme includes eight CPU cores (three high-performance Zen 5 cores, five smaller and efficiency-optimized Zen 5C cores) and an unnamed RDNA 3.5 GPU with 16 of AMD's compute units (CUs). These should both provide small bumps to CPU and GPU performance relative to the Ryzen Z1 Extreme, which used eight Zen 4 CPU cores and 12 RDNA 3 GPU cores.

The Ryzen Z2, on the other hand, appears to be exactly the same chip as the Ryzen Z1 Extreme, but with a different name. Like the Z1 Extreme, it has eight Zen 4 cores with a 5.1 GHz maximum clock speed and an RDNA 3 GPU with 12 cores.

item.title: Paizo Announces Pathfinder Lost Omens Shining Kingdoms and Treasure Vault: Remastered
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/paizo-announces-pathfinder-lost-omens-shining-kingdoms-and-treasure-vault-remastered

Paizo is bringing two new sourcebooks to Pathfinder Second Edition. The largest fantasy TTRPG competitor to Dungeons & Dragons has two books arriving in the first half of 2025. One is a remaster of an older book. The second is a supplement: Pathfinder Lost Omens Shining Kingdoms.

The Pathfinder Lost Omens Shining Kingdoms Announcement

According to the official store page, Pathfinder Lost Omens Shining Kingdoms will focus on six key nations of the Inner Sea. The aptly named Shining Kingdoms are lands full of knightly orders, proud ancient cultures, and deadly court intrigue.

This new supplement for Pathfinder Second Edition will delve into these six nations.

Andoran is the bastion of democratic freedom. Druma is the kingdom's trade hub. The Five Kings Mountains are the home of the fractured dwarven kingdoms. Galt is the land perpetually wracked with violent revolutions. Kyonin is the homeland of the elves cloaked in illusion. Last is Taldor, the ossified remnants of one of the Inner Sea's greatest empires.

Each region in Pathfinder Lost Omens Shining Kingdoms will present new player options. These include new archetypes, equipment, magic items, spells, and animal companions. Players can also learn more about each region's factions such as Andoran's Eagle Knights or the Shieldwrought Striders of the Five Kings Mountains.

For DMs, the supplement will include a bestiary of monsters and a fold-out poster map to serve as a centerpiece for a Shining Kingdoms campaign.

The second supplement is Pathfinder Treasure Vault Remastered. As the name implies, this is a reprinting of the Treasure Vault supplement with its terms and gameplay revised to align with Pathfinder Second Edition Remastered. If you already own the original version, it will remain compatible with this new version of the game. However, if you want the most up to date version, the option is here.

Both Pathfinder Lost Omens Shining Kingdoms and Pathfinder Treasure Vault Remastered will release in June 2025. Shining Kingdoms is available at an MSRP of $59.99. Treasure Vault Remastered is available at an MSRP of $64.99.

Marvel Rivals is entering its second season, confusingly named Season 1 because the first one was Season 0, and it‚Äôs bringing four new heroes to the game all at once. The Fantastic Four are joining the roster on January 10, seemingly alongside a new map, a balance patch, and a battle pass. Developer NetEase is rolling out information on Season 1: Eternal Night Falls throughout the week, so we‚Äôll be updating this post with new details as they come. The Fantastic Four join the fight

Headlining the season are the Fantastic Four, with Mister Fantastic, The Thing, Invisible Woman, and Human Torch all joining the roster. Mister Fantastic and Human Torch appear to be damage-dealing Duelists, with The Thing being a tanky Vanguard and Invisible Woman rounding out the team as a supporting Strategist. Capcom's Resident Evil 4 remake is a huge hit. The publisher has confirmed the 2023 game has sold 9 million copies, with some estimates stating this makes it the fastest-selling Resident Evil game of all time.

Industry analyst Alex Aniel said (via SI) that sales at this level make the Resident Evil 4 remake the "by far, the fastest-selling Resident Evil ever." Capcom announced that the game had cleared 8 million copies as of mid-October 2024, so it appears sales during the holiday helped boost the game beyond 9 million.

Resident Evil 4 (2023) has sold 9 million copies as of December 19, 2024 üòÆ
That would mean RE4 sold at least 1 million copies last quarter (October 1 through December 31), which would be the game's 8th quarter overall.
This makes RE4, by far, the fastest selling RE ever. https://t.co/S7q7afU8aV

‚Äî Alex Aniel (@cvxfreak) January 6, 2025

Resident Evil is far and away Capcom's biggest franchise by sales volume, with total sales exceeding 163 million units. The next closest is Monster Hunter (105 million).

2019's Resident Evil 2 remains the highest-selling Resident Evil game ever, with 14.5 million copies sold, followed by Resident Evil 7 (14 million), Resident Evil Village (10.5 million), Resident Evil 5 (9.4 million). Resident Evil 6 (9.3 million),and Resident Evil 3 (9.2 million). Capcom's website that lists all of its best-selling games hasn't been updated with the latest Resident Evil 4 remake sales--it still shows 8 million sales--but it would rank No. 10 overall with 9 million sales.

The 2005 original Resident Evil 4, meanwhile, sold 2.3 million copies.

item.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming coming to new LG Smart TVs
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/01/06/xbox-cloud-gaming-coming-to-new-lg-smart-tvs/

Microsoft has announced a partnership with LG to bring Xbox Cloud Gaming to LG‚Äôs new Smart TVs, and Xbox Game Pass Ultimate members will be able to use it. Those who have this membership will be able to access Xbox Game Pass games through the Xbox app on LG TVs, and will not need an Xbox console. It is all part of Microsoft‚Äôs This Is an Xbox plan, which is the company‚Äôs push to show how many devices Xbox games can be played on.

As part of the partnership, Game Pass Ultimate players will also be able to stream their own games that they own, as long as they are part of the initial 50 launch titles for the service. This service is already available on other devices. In its announcement post, Microsoft said, ‚ÄúToday, we‚Äôre excited to announce our collaboration with LG Electronics to bring the Xbox app to their new LG Smart TVs later this year. This means Game Pass Ultimate members will be able to play their games directly from the Xbox app on supported LG Smart TVs via Xbox Cloud Gaming. This gives players even more choice in how they enjoy their favorite games. Soon, players with LG Smart TVs will be able to explore the Gaming Portal for direct access to hundreds of games in the Game Pass Ultimate catalog, including popular titles such as Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, and upcoming releases like Avowed (launching February 18, 2025).‚Äù

item.title: US designates Tencent and CATL as Chinese military companies
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/6/24337489/tencent-catl-us-defense-department-chinese-military-companies

US designates Tencent and CATL as Chinese military companies

/

The designation could make it harder for the owner of Riot Games and the world‚Äôs largest EV battery maker to do business in the US.

By Emma Roth, a news writer who covers the streaming wars, consumer tech, crypto, social media, and much more. Previously, she was a writer and editor at MUO.

Jan 6, 2025, 8:36 PM UTC

Share this story

The US Department of Defense has added tech giant Tencent and lithium-ion battery maker CATL to its list of Chinese military companies, as reported earlier by Bloomberg. The designation doesn‚Äôt impose sanctions or a ban, but it could make it more difficult for the companies to do business in the US.

Along with owning the popular messaging app WeChat, Tencent is a major name in the gaming industry, as it owns League of Legends developer Riot Games and has invested in many others, including Epic Games, Larian Studios, Ubisoft, and FromSoftware. Meanwhile, CATL is the world‚Äôs biggest electric vehicle battery maker, with its products appearing across EVs from Tesla, Ford, Volkswagen, BMW, and more.

The designations originate from President-elect Donald Trump‚Äôs executive order in 2020, which prevented US companies from investing in entities with ties to the Chinese military. DJI, which was put on the list in 2022, says US Customs is blocking its drone imports and eventually filed a lawsuit claiming the designation has resulted in ‚Äúlost business deals‚Äù and a stigma ‚Äúas a national security threat.‚Äù

These companies don‚Äôt always stay on the Department of Defense‚Äôs list, as the US removed Chinese phone maker Xiaomi just months after adding it in 2021. Both Tencent and CATL plan to push back on the designations. ‚ÄúWe are not a military company or supplier,‚Äù Tencent spokesperson Danny Marti said in a statement to The Verge. ‚ÄúUnlike sanctions or export controls, this listing has no impact on our business. We will nonetheless work with the Department of Defense to address any misunderstanding.‚Äù CATL spokesperson Fred Zhang similarly told The Verge that its inclusion was ‚Äúa mistake,‚Äù adding that ‚ÄúCATL is not engaged in any military related activities.‚Äù

item.title: Nintendo Switch Cartridges Are Being Replaced With Googly Eyes
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/nintendo-switch-cartridges-are-being-replaced-with-googly-eyes/1100-6528654/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo Switch users are reporting that some recently purchased Switch games have arrived with the game cartridge missing from inside the box. Even odder, the cartridges appear to have been swapped out for‚Ä¶ googly eyes.

Over the holidays, posts about the bizarre phenomenon began popping up on social media. Multiple players have shared photos of freshly unwrapped Switch game cases holding a lone googly eye in the spot where the game itself should be.

"The Grinch got us this year," reads one Reddit post featuring a photo of a Super Mario Party Jamboree case with a lone googly eye in the space meant for the game cartridge.

It's not clear how widespread the issue is, nor is it clear who the culprit is. Some players suspect that warehouse workers somewhere along the supply chain are snatching the cartridges (likely with the intent to resell them) and replacing them with a googly eye so the weight of the missing cartridge goes unnoticed, or for the purpose of making sure the box sounds like it still has a game inside it when shaken.

Though the exact source of the missing game cartridges remains unknown, multiple comments and posts mention purchasing a Switch game from Walmart and finding nothing but a googly eye inside, suggesting one of the retail giant's warehouses may be the source of the problem.

One Reddit user says they've fallen victim to the googly eye switcheroo multiple times.

"Bought Tears of the Kingdom at a Walmart in Arizona, and this happened to me," they wrote. "Walmart refused to refund/replace, blaming Nintendo. Had to twist their arms a bit, but Nintendo eventually gave me a digital copy of the game. Recently, I went to Walmart to buy Pok√©mon Violet. I asked if the clerk would watch me open it because I told them about what happened with TotK. Bro was beside himself when I cracked it open to reveal yet another googly eye. They swapped out the game for another (which we also checked)."

Neither Walmart nor Nintendo have commented on the issue. For now, an issue at Walmart warehouses or distribution centers seems to be the likeliest culprit. But it's also possible that Santa simply ran out of coal this year.

item.title: These Are The Two Best Vanguard Heroes In Marvel Rivals
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/marvel-rivals-best-vanguard-peni-parker-venom-1851733445

Marvel Rivals features three types of heroes: Vanguards, Duelists, and Strategists. Arguably, the Vanguard can change the tide of battle the most. Traditionally known as tanks, the role of these heroes is to soak up damage to let the rest of their team invade the objective and make their way in.

Suggested Reading

Kotaku Unboxes The Spider-Man 2 Limited Edition PS5

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Read More: These Are The Two Best Strategists In Marvel Rivals

While much of Marvel Rivals is designed to remind players of early Overwatch, the design philosophy behind Vanguard characters seems to be more reminiscent of the Blizzard shooter‚Äôs later stages. Shields dominated the Tank meta early in Overwatch, mostly due to their immense health pool. However, in Marvel Rivals, the strongest shield has less than half the hit points of Overwatch‚Äôs original Reinhardt shield (2,000 compared to 800). These Tanks focus more on diving in and disrupting the enemy. Across Marvel Rivals‚Äô vast roster of heroes, these are the two Vanguard characters who stand out the most.

Venom is an easy-to-learn menace

Marvel Rivals‚Äô tanks focus much more on diving and disrupting than just soaking damage in the front line. And no one can dive in and distract the opposition quite like Spidey‚Äôs frenemy, Venom. His web-swinging is a perfectly suited movement ability, letting him charge and really make a splash on any objective. His attacks may feel a little weak, but his best strength is survivability, making him a perfect Tank.

The most important tool in Venom‚Äôs kit is the Symbiotic Resilience ability . This move grants Venom a temporary shield based on the amount of health he‚Äôs lost. Popping this ability can nearly double Venom‚Äôs health pool, making it a perfect move for turning the tables on your enemy. He also has a pretty powerful Team-Up Ability, granting an excellent new ability to Spider-Man.

Peni Parker can hold an objective like no other

Peni Parker is one of the more unique characters in Marvel Rivals. Instead of tanking damage by diving or putting up shields, Peni can hunker down in one spot and effectively prevent the enemy from advancing. Using both webs and mines, she can make the objective hard to invade while giving herself bonus health.

Additionally, Peni can tether herself to her webs, ensuring that opportunistic Duelists can‚Äôt knock her too far from the objective. This can also be used to push far into enemy lines, only to pull back when things get dire. While Peni is best on defense, this ability gives her some offensive utility as well.

Overall, Peni Parker is annoying as hell to fight against. Hopefully, she‚Äôs annoying your opponents instead of you.

Marvel Rivals is available on PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and Windows via Steam.

item.title: Counter-Strike 2 Adds Train to Map Pool Ahead of Next Major
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/cs2-adds-train-to-map-pool/

For the third straight Major in a row, the most illustrious Counter-Strike 2 Major will feature a different active duty map pool. Valve announced today that the remade Train will replace Vertigo in time for the BLAST.tv Austin Major in April 2025.

With the next CS2 Major using this map pool, many are now expecting the in-game Premier pool and other official tournaments to swap in Train in place of Vertigo.

End of The Line for Vertigo

Train officially returned to Counter-Strike, debuting for the first time in CS2, back in November 2024. The reworked map has been subjected to a complete visual overhaul (including a gorgeous rain effect when outdoors) and several major gameplay changes. Notably, both bombsites are now more open with less train car clutter, the Heaven area looking down on the A site is gone, and the ‚ÄúPopdog‚Äù ladder has been expanded to a long spiral staircase. The CS2 community as a whole has eagerly been waiting for Train to come to CS2 for some time.

While Train‚Äôs arrival to the Active Duty map pool was inevitable, Valve has finally confirmed which map it will replace: Vertigo. At the professional level, outside of a couple of top North American teams, Vertigo has been one of the least played maps. According to statistics from HLTV, it is the least played map at big events in 2024 other than Overpass, which was removed from the map pool during the year.

The only thing that remains unclear is when Train will officially be implemented in the in-game and other tournament map pools. The 2025 calendar for CS2 is set to officially begin just as week from now with BLAST Spring Bounty 2025. With the changes to the CS2 ecosystem, all big events will affect the global standings that determine who is invited to the Major or its closed qualifiers.

item.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming is coming to LG TVs
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/xbox-cloud-gaming-is-coming-to-lg-tvs

Starting "later this year".

Microsoft's push to deliver Xbox gaming without requiring users to purchase Xbox hardware is set to continue in 2025, with Xbox Cloud Gaming support officially coming to LG TVs.

Starting "later this year", LG TV owners will be able to download the Xbox app and play "hundreds" of titles from the Game Pass Ultimate catalogue via cloud streaming, including Obsidian Entertainment's upcoming Avowed (which launches in February) and Eurogamer's Game of the Year 2024, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

Microsoft notes the Xbox app on LG TVs will also support the recently introduced ability for users to stream "select" Xbox games they already own - from the current list of "over 50" titles - even if they're not presently available as part of Game Pass.

In all cases, an Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription is required (starting at ¬£14.99 a month), as is a "supported" LG Smart TV. Microsoft's initial announcement doesn't detail which TVs will be compatible with the service, but it says more details will be shared in the "coming months".

Xbox Cloud Gaming's arrival on LG TVs follows its launch on Amazon Fire TV devices last year and on Samsung TVs in 2022. Xbox boss Phil Spencer previously confirmed the Xbox app was Microsoft's new approach to bringing cloud gaming to the masses after it pulled the plug on its own Xbox cloud gaming device, codenamed Keystone, back in 2022.

item.title: Xbox App To Come To Select LG Smart TVs, Ultimate Game Pass Subscribers to Benefit
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/xbox-app-to-come-to-select-lg-smart-tvs-ultimate-game-pass-subscribers-to-benefit/

Microsoft has been on a mission to peddle its products with the slogan of "Xbox Anywhere." This includes being able to stream or play Xbox titles on their PCs, TVs, and even phones. Today, it's been announced by Xbox that there is a partnership with LG Electronics to bring the Xbox App to specific LG Smart TVs.

This means that those who have an LG Smart TV will gain access to the Xbox Gaming portal, where people will then get access to the Game Pass Ultimate catalog, allowing those interested to have access to top games like Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and the highly anticipated title, Avowed. To play the games, people will need to have an Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription and a compatible Bluetooth wireless controller to play games through the Xbox App. Additionally, those who are Xbox Game Pass members will also have the opportunity to play their own games. At the moment, there are only 50 games this applies to, with the list of games available on the Xbox Wire page, where you can find out all of the info regarding streaming your games.

"We are thrilled to announce the partnership with Xbox, which aims to enrich the gaming experience on LG Smart TVs with a broader selection of popular games. The Gaming Portal will provide users with a seamless, convenient, and exciting way to enhance the gaming experience on LG Smart TVs," says Chris Jo, the Senior Vice President of Platform Business at LG.

At the moment, the specific TVs haven't been specified by Xbox or LG, with the post created on Xbox Wire simply stating that the collaboration will go to their new LG Smart TVs "later this year."

This is all a relatively new venture for Xbox, as the ability to stream your own game on select platforms is also a trial that they are exploring and is an attempt to bring the Xbox Cloud Gaming Experience to the forefront, as they are slowly stepping away from focusing on console releases, and are trying to look at the bigger picture. However, it has been confirmed by Phil Spencer that they are continuing to explore new hardware and consoles that will be made in the future despite the difficulties in profit and cost.

Despite the troublesome time that Xbox has seemingly experienced as of late, according to Mat Piscatella, Xbox is going to turn it around and will get to experience a bright future. A lot of this could boil down to the fact that they are no longer doing Xbox Exclusives, as they want to push the game onto as many platforms as possible.

Now it's just a waiting game to see how smooth the Xbox Cloud Gaming experience is on an LG Smart TV.

item.title: Everyone‚Äôs favorite office monitor is getting even better
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/6/24336649/dell-ultrasharp-4k-office-monitors-120hz-price-availability

Dell has made its latest UltraSharp 4K monitors more attractive to PC gamers by doubling the previous generation‚Äôs 60Hz refresh rate. The 27-inch and 32-inch 4K UltraSharp Thunderbolt displays announced at CES have been updated with new IPS panels that provide 120Hz refresh rates alongside features designed to enhance visual comfort.

The UltraSharp line is a popular choice for working professionals who need a no-frills 4K monitor that supports Windows, macOS, and multi-monitor setups ‚Äî the 27-inch model in particular tops a lot of lists for best 4K monitor. 120Hz refresh rates are usually targeted toward gamers who can benefit from higher frame rates and smoother, more responsive gameplay, which now makes the 27-inch UltraSharp 4K in particular a decent solution for people who want a single display that‚Äôs suitable for both work and play.

The improvements come at a cost though: the 27-inch UltraSharp 4K is increasing to $699.99 (up from $639.99 for the 60Hz model), and the larger 32-inch UltraSharp 4K now costs $949.99 (up from $919.99). Both will be available to buy globally starting February 25th, according to Dell.

Image: Dell

Dell introduced several 120Hz monitors to the UltraSharp lineup in 2023 and 2024, but this is the first time that the popular 27-inch 4K model has seen a similar refresh rate boost. Other improvements for the new UltraSharp 4K models include up to 140W power delivery via USB-C (up from 90W), and a 3,000:1 contrast ratio, thanks to its use of ‚Äúenhanced IPS Black technology‚Äù that provides 47 percent deeper blacks compared to conventional IPS panels, according to Dell. The prior version of IPS Black offered a 2,000:1 contrast ratio. A comparison showing improvements in contrast ratio can be seen in this YouTube video.

Image: Dell

Dell says the monitors include an ambient light sensor that automatically adjusts brightness and color temperature to help reduce eye fatigue. Otherwise, the 27-inch and 32-inch 4K UltraSharp share near-identical designs with their predecessors. The new models include VESA DisplayHDR 600 and ports for USB-A, USB-C, Thunderbolt 4, HDMI, and DisplayPort, with ventilation grills now surrounding the ports located on the back of the monitors.

item.title: AMD announces next-gen Radeon RX 9070-series GPUs with AI-powered FSR 4 upscaling
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/6/24336246/amd-radeon-rx-9070-series-rdna-4-fsr-4-ces-2025

AMD is previewing its next generation of GPUs at CES today, based on its latest RDNA 4 architecture that includes AI-powered FidelityFX Super Resolution 4 (FSR 4) upscaling. The Radeon RX 9070 XT and Radeon RX 9070 will both be available in Q1 from a variety of video card manufacturers, but AMD isn‚Äôt detailing specifications, pricing, or exact release dates just yet.

The announcement is light on concrete information. AMD says it has built this architecture from the ground up and that the GPUs built on RDNA 4 will include ‚Äúa significant boost in AI.‚Äù AMD has optimized the compute units in RNDA 4, improved its ray-tracing engine and performance, and upgraded its media encoding quality. Built on a 4nm process, the RX 9070 XT and RX 9070 cards will include AMD‚Äôs second-generation AI accelerators, third-generation ray-tracing accelerators, and second-generation radiance display engine.

Image: AMD

This RDNA 4 architecture will also enable AMD to launch FSR 4 with these 9000-series GPUs. FSR 4 is a machine learning-powered update to AMD‚Äôs upscaling and frame-generation technology that‚Äôs been developed specifically for RDNA 4 and its dedicated AI accelerator hardware. That means you‚Äôll only be able to get FSR 4 with a Radeon RX 9070-series graphics card right now, and it will be supported in games with FSR 3.1 already integrated.

Matt Booty, president of game content and studios at Microsoft, appeared on stage at AMD‚Äôs CES keynote earlier today to confirm FSR 4 will be available in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 later this year.

AMD hasn‚Äôt hinted at how FSR 4 will compare to Nvidia‚Äôs DLSS technology or what type of performance uplift or image quality improvement we should expect to see with this next generation of FSR.

It‚Äôs also not clear exactly what performance the RX 9070 series of GPUs will deliver against the competition, but in a branding slide for RDNA 4, AMD appears to suggest the 9070 series will offer similar performance to the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Ti and RTX 4070 Super. Nvidia is expected to announce its RTX 50-series GPUs later today.

Image: AMD

AMD is also adding new AI-powered features to its Adrenalin software. These include the ability to generate images with AI models, summarize local documents, and ask an AMD chatbot questions about graphics settings and more. 

If you‚Äôre wondering why AMD has jumped from the Radeon 7000 series straight to 9000-series GPUs, the company says it will use the 8000-series branding for RDNA 3.5 mobile GPUs. AMD is only previewing FSR 4 at CES and promises to provide more details on the upscaling technology and its latest RDNA 4 GPUs ahead of the Q1 launch.

item.title: Acer made an enormous 11-inch gaming handheld
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/6/24335423/acer-handheld-gaming-pc-nitro-blaze-8-11-specs-price

Acer is announcing two new Nitro Blaze gaming handhelds at CES 2025, and one of them, the Nitro Blaze 11, is truly giant with a massive 10.95-inch screen.

Seriously, it‚Äôs huge ‚Äî just look at this photo of a person holding it! It‚Äôs absurd!

In addition to that enormous screen ‚Äî which is a 144 Hz WQXGA touch display that can top out at 500 nits of brightness ‚Äî the Nitro Blaze 11 is equipped with an AMD Ryzen 8040HS processor, 16GB of LPDDR5X RAM, and up to 2TB of storage, according to a press release. The Nitro Blaze 11 also has detachable controllers, a built-in kickstand, Hall Effect joysticks, and two back buttons. (The original Blaze, announced last year with a 7-inch screen, lacked back buttons.)

Acer‚Äôs other new handheld PC, the Nitro Blaze 8, is mercifully smaller, with an 8.8-inch screen. It has many of the same specs as the Nitro Blaze 11, though it lacks the detachable controllers and built-in stand.

Both new Blazes will be available in Q2 2025, Acer says. The Nitro Blaze 11 will start at $1,099.99, while the Nitro Blaze 8 will start at $899.99.

item.title: New Xbox Controller Is Basically A Fancy PS5 Gamepad

At CES 2025, accessory and controller maker Hyperkin revealed its upcoming Xbox gamepad that is inspired by Sony‚Äôs PS5 DualSense controller. However, this new wired controller is much more than just an Xbox pad designed for folks who prefer the layout and shape of a PlayStation controller.

Hyperkin‚Äôs controller, dubbed The Competitor, was first announced in 2019 before being officially unveiled in 2020. But since then, the controller maker has completely redesigned it. While the new design is still intended to make it an Xbox Series X/S controller for people who want the ergonomics of a DualSense gamepad, this time around it looks far more like a DualSense, featuring a separated d-pad, a mic mute button, and more PS5-like triggers and colors.

Here‚Äôs a slick-looking trailer for the upcoming PlayStation-styled Xbox controller via IGN:

According to Hyperkin via The Verge, this new controller will be wired only and will include Hall Effect thumb sticks, which should mean you won‚Äôt experience the dreaded stick drift effect just a few months after buying it. (This is a feature that standard Xbox and PS5 controllers don‚Äôt have!) The upcoming controller also features two programable back buttons. You‚Äôll be able to use The Competitor on Xbox consoles as well as your PC.

Hyperkin didn‚Äôt reveal a price point, but I‚Äôd expect something in the $60 to $100 range. The controller company says its PS5-like Xbox gamepad will be available later this year.

Being able to use The Competitor on PC is nice, as a lot of games still don‚Äôt include PS button icons when you‚Äôre using a PlayStation controller. This should, in theory, act like an Xbox controller when plugged into Steam, but it will feel like a PlayStation controller when using it. Just don‚Äôt get confused about which X button to hit when a QTE prompt appears!

Activision has unveiled the bracket for the Call of Duty League‚Äôs first ‚ÄòMinor‚Äô, one of the new tournaments set up to make the CDL 2025 season feel much more dense. The Minor tournaments offer a stopgap between Majors, and while they have a much smaller prize pool, they‚Äôll feature just as much excitement and skill from the players.

Minor tournaments are hosted online and feature a one-shot $20,000 prize for the ultimate victor.

Minor Win, Major Effort

The first CDL Minor will occur between January 10 and 12, and all twelve teams in the CDL are invited to participate. It‚Äôs a single-elimination tournament, which means every loss will knock one team out of the running for the $20,000 prize.

item.title: PS5 Users Are Divided Straight Down the Middle Over Turning Their Console Off or Putting It in Rest Mode
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/ps5-users-are-divided-straight-down-the-middle-over-turning-their-console-off-or-putting-it-in-rest-mode

PlayStation 5 users are torn over how to treat their precious console between gaming sessions, with 50% choosing to turn it off completely and 50% choosing to put it in rest mode.

Sony Interactive Entertainment's vice president of game, product, and player experiences, Cory Gasaway, told Game File that the Welcome Hub feature, which debuted last year, came as a result of discovering this even split in player habits.

"We gained a lot of insights about how players interact with their PS5 system between play sessions," Gasaway said. "A small example is we had an internal hypothesis that far more people would put their console into rest mode than fully shut it down each time between their play sessions.

"As it turned out, it was actually about 50/50 between the two options for all our players. So, what that meant was for about 50% of our users, when they booted up, if they were in the US, they were landing on our Explore page. Those outside the U.S. would land on the page for the last game that they have played."

The Welcome Hub was therefore developed long after the PS5's release for these players who do not use rest mode, something Sony didn't believe necessary until it looked into these stats. It arrived in September and essentially lets players customize their homescreen with different widgets and bits of useful information.

item.title: The Pok√©mon Center Declares 2025 the Year of Eevee

Forget Year of Luigi. 2025 is the Year of Eevee. At least, according to The Pok√©mon Center, the official merch arm of The Pok√©mon Company.

This was announced today via the official Pok√©mon website, which christened the year by announcing an array of Eevee-themed merchandise such as plush toys and Eeveelution statuettes.

Notably, the "Year of Eevee" thus far appears only to impact The Pok√©mon Center, the official merchandise store for Pok√©mon. So it's entirely possible this is purely a marketing thing to sell more Eevee plush, and won't impact anything else.

But it's also possible this celebration ends up extending to other parts of Pok√©mon. For instance, we know for a fact that a new Pok√©mon game is planned for later this year: Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A. We don't have a ton of information about the game so far, apart from its setting (Lumiose City) and its placement in the "Pok√©mon Legends" series alongside Pok√©mon Legends: Arceus. A Year of Eevee could portend exciting things for Z-A... dare I predict, a new Eeveelution? There hasn't been one of those since Sylveon was added in Pok√©mon X and Y (where Lumiose City was introduced) over a decade ago. We're long overdue for a new variation. Unfortunately, we probably can't expect an entirely Eevee-focused game. We've already basically had one of those in Pok√©mon Let's Go! Pikachu and Eevee.

And it's worth noting that the Eevee theming has already invaded the Pok√©mon TCG via the recent Prismatic Evolution expansion. The new expansion, which releases next week, centers around Terastal Pok√©mon like in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, but notably includes some absolutely gorgeous Eeveelution cards and even features a Terastal on the cover. Every Eeveelution is included in the set in multiple forms, including an Umbreon that some are predicting will be very, very coveted by collectors.

Beyond that, I'm really hoping this means we'll see some exciting Eevee-themed updates to other games. Pok√©mon's been juggling quite a few ongoing games lately, including Pok√©mon Sleep, Pok√©mon Unite, Pok√©mon Masters EX, and of course Pok√©mon Go. Between all of those, surely there will be room for some interesting Eevee-themed updates over the next year to tie into the merch plays. We'll have to see how far The Pok√©mon Company chooses to take things while we eagerly away for more news about Pok√©mon Legends Z-A. Don't forget, Pok√©mon Day is on February 27!

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons Gets $7,000 Pinball Machine Voiced by My Chemical Romance Singer Gerard Way
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/dungeons-dragons-gets-7000-pinball-machine-voiced-by-my-chemical-romance-singer-gerard-way

Thank you for the Dagger of Venom.

Dungeons & Dragons is getting a $6,999 pinball machine voiced by myriad celebrities including the Critical Role cast and, more randomly, My Chemical Romance lead singer Gerard Way.

As reported by VG247, Dungeons & Dragons: The Tyrant's Eye from Stern Pinball lacks a release date but has been revealed with three separate editions. Those looking for a cheaper option are out of luck, however, as the $6,999 price tag is the cheapest.

This gets fans the Pro edition, while the Premium costs $9,699 and the Limited Edition, capped at 740 machines total as an ode to the 1974 release date of D&D, costs $12,999.

Dungeons & Dragons: The Tyrant's Eye

The Tyrant's Eye, at all editions, features a story where players must defeat the Dragon Queen Tiamat and, in true D&D fashion, features different story paths depending on randomly decided outcomes. A star-studded voice cast contributes to the pinball machine, including the aforementioned emo singer.

Critical Role's Matthew Mercer, Laura Bailey, and Marisha Ray all appear too, alongside Michael Dorn, Kevin Smith, Luke Gygax, Chris Prynoski, Brendon Small, Anthony Carboni, and Mica Burton. Way's inclusion is perhaps not completely random, as he is a known fan of the tabletop role-playing game and has been for years.

"Enjoy mysterious and exciting features by navigating through hidden passageways, experience an electromagnet-powered gelatinous cube that freezes the pinball, and explore dynamic dungeon levels that are accessed through a disappearing playfield trap door," the official synopsis reads.

"Other features include Fizmo‚Äôs store that allows players to acquire unique items, a treasure chest that unleashes mimic monsters, and more secrets to uncover." It also includes "the most advanced animatronic mech in pinball" in the form of Rath the red dragon, which "intelligently reacts to player action with multi-axis motion."

Those able to nab the limited edition can, alongside bragging rights, also enjoy the interactive speaker expression lighting system with D&D sound effects, an exclusive red design, and an autograph from designer Brian Eddy.
